verbs.description: upstare (third-person singular simple present upstares, present participle upstaring, simple past and past participle upstared)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To stare or stand erect or on end; be erect or conspicuous; bristle.
examples: In the street or road he reluctantly wore a hat, but in fields or gardens his little round head had no other covering than his long, wild, ragged locks." These wild locks upstared more wildly when Shelley, having dipped his head, [...]
